tit.j: 国立国会図書館関西館
tit.e: Kansai-kan of the National Diet Library
Kansai-kan of the National Diet Library
Kansai-kan of the National Diet Library

sen.j: 国立国会図書館 関西館（こくりつこっかいとしょかん かんさいかん）は、京都府相楽郡精華町にある国立国会図書館の関西本館。
sen.e: The Kansai-kan of the National Diet Library (NDL) is the Kansai Main Library of the NDL and is situated in Seika-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Kansai-kan, as the Kansai Main Library of the National Diet Library (NDL), is located in Seika-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Kansai-kan, as the Kansai Main Library of the National Diet Library (NDL), is located in Seika-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 東京都千代田区永田町に所在する国立国会図書館・東京本館の蔵書収容能力が限界に達しつつあるため、高度情報化社会に対応した「電子図書館」の機能をも盛り込み、2002年10月に京都府相楽郡精華町の関西文化学術研究都市に開館した。
sen.e: Since the NDL Tokyo Main Library (Nagata-cho, Chiyoda Ward, Tokyo Prefecture) almost reached its full storage capacity, it was decided to build a new facility serving as a "digital library" for highly-advanced information society. The new facility was built in Kansai Science City (Keihanna Science City) (Seika-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture), and was opened to the public as Kansai-kan of the NDL in October 2002.

Because the NDL Tokyo Main Library (Nagata-cho, Chiyoda Ward, Tokyo Prefecture) had nearly reached its full storage capacity, it was decided to build a new facility serving as a "digital library" for the highly advanced information society; the new facility was built in Kansai Science City (Keihanna Science City) (Seika-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture), and was opened to the public as Kansai-kan of the NDL in October 2002.

Because the NDL Tokyo Main Library (Nagata-cho, Chiyoda Ward, Tokyo Prefecture) had nearly reached its full storage capacity, it was decided to build a new facility that would serve as a 'digital library' for the highly advanced information society; the new facility was built in Kansai Science City (Keihanna Science City) (Seika-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture), and was opened to the public as the Kansai-kan of the NDL in October 2002.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にしました。Serveを補足しました。

sen.j: 建築家陶器二三雄設計の建物は日本建築学会賞を受賞している。
sen.e: The building designed by an architect Fumio TOKI was awarded the Prizes of AIJ (Architectural Institute of Japan).
The building, which was designed by the architect Fumio TOKI, was awarded the Prize of AIJ (Architectural Institute of Japan).
The building, which was designed by the architect Fumio TOKI, was awarded the Prize of AIJ (Architectural Institute of Japan).

sen.j: 1978年11月 「近畿圏基本整備計画」の内閣総理大臣決定：関西の自治体や学会、経済界から「第二国立国会図書館」（仮称）の設置要望が高まる。
sen.e: November 1978: The "Basic Development Plan for the Kinki Region" was signed off by the prime minister. A demand for the establishment of the Second NDL (provisional name) from local governments, academic society, and economic circles in the Kansai region was growing.

In November 1978, the "Basic Development Plan for the Kinki Region" was signed by the Prime Minister, thus signaling a growing demand for the establishment of the Second NDL (provisional name) from local governments, academic society and economic circles in the Kansai region.

November 1978: The 'Basic Development Plan for the Kinki Region' was signed by the Prime Minister, thus signaling a growing demand for the establishment of the Second NDL (provisional name) from local governments, academic society and economic circles in the Kansai region.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にしました。"In November 1978,"→"November 1978:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1982年6月 国立国会図書館関西プロジェクト調査会が発足。
sen.e: June 1982: Research Committee for the Kansai Project of the National Diet Library (NDL) was established.
June 1982: The Research Committee for the Kansai Project of the National Diet Library (NDL) was established.
June 1982: The Research Committee for the Kansai Project of the National Diet Library (NDL) was established.

sen.j: 1987年4月 同調査会、京阪奈丘陵（後の関西文化学術研究都市）への「第二国立国会図書館」の設置を答申。
sen.e: April 1987: Report on the establishment of a new facility in Keihanna hill (now Kansai Science City) submitted by the Research Committee to the Librarian.
April 1987: A report on the establishment of a new facility in Keihanna hill (now Kansai Science City) was submitted by the Research Committee to the chief librarian.
April 1987: A report on the establishment of a new facility in Keihanna hill (now Kansai Science City) was submitted by the Research Committee to the chief librarian.

sen.j: 1987年5月 「国立国会図書館第二国立国会図書館（仮称）設立計画本部」が設置される。
sen.e: May 1978: "The Second NDL (provisional name) Project Headquarters" was established.
May 1978: "The Second NDL (provisional name) Project Headquarters" was established.
May 1987: 'The Project Headquarters for the Second NDL (provisional name)' was established.
sen.cmt: 年号の間違えを修正しました。原文の「」に合わせ"を'にしました。

sen.j: 同年7月 同本部「国立国会図書館関西館（仮称）設立に関する第一次基本構想」を館長に提出。
sen.e: July 1987: "First Basic Plan for the Establishment of the Kansai-kan (provisional name) of the NDL" was submitted to the Chief Librarian of the NDL.
July 1987: The "First Basic Plan for the Establishment of the Kansai-kan (provisional name) of the NDL" was submitted to the Chief Librarian of the NDL.
July 1987: The 'First Basic Plan for the Establishment of the Kansai-kan of the NDL (provisional name)' was submitted to the chief librarian of the NDL.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にしました。(provisional name) の位置をセル21の文に合わせました。

sen.j: 1991年8月 特別顧問会議、「国立国会図書館関西館（仮称）設立に関する第二次基本構想」を策定。
sen.e: August 1991: "Second Basic Plan for the Establishment of the Kansai-kan of the NDL (provisional name)" was drawn up at the advisory meeting.
August 1991: The "Second Basic Plan for the Establishment of the Kansai-kan of the NDL (provisional name)" was drawn up at the advisory meeting.
August 1991: The 'Second Basic Plan for the Establishment of the Kansai-kan of the NDL (provisional name)' was drawn up at the advisory meeting.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にしました。

sen.j: 1994年5月 関西館準備室設置。
sen.e: May 1994: Kansai-kan Project Office was established.
May 1994: The Kansai-kan Project Office was established.
May 1994: The Kansai-kan Project Office was established.

sen.j: 同年12月 国立国会図書館建築委員会、関西館の建設を国会に勧告、「国立国会図書館関西館（仮称）建設基本計画概要」を提出。
sen.e: December 1994: Recommendations for construction of the Kansai-kan submitted by the NDL Building Commission to the Diet. The "Outline of the Basic Construction Plan of the Kansai-kan (provisional name) of the NDL" was also submitted.

December 1994: Recommendations for construction of the Kansai-kan were submitted by the NDL Building Commission to the Diet; additionally, the "Outline of the Basic Construction Plan of the Kansai-kan (provisional name) of the NDL" was submitted.

December 1994: Recommendations for construction of the Kansai-kan were submitted by the NDL Building Commission to the Diet; additionally, the 'Outline of the Basic Construction Plan of the Kansai-kan of the NDL (provisional name)' was submitted.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にしました。(provisional name) の位置をセル21の文に合わせました。

sen.j: 参議院（同月）および衆議院（翌年1月）がこれを了承。
sen.e: The recommendation was approved in the House of Councillors in December 1994 and in the House of Representatives in January 1995.
The recommendation was approved by the House of Councilors in December 1994 and by the House of Representatives in January 1995.
The recommendation was approved by the House of Councilors in December 1994 and by the House of Representatives in January 1995.

sen.j: 1996年8月 陶器二三雄の設計が採用される。
sen.e: August 1996: A design by Fumio TOKI was adopted.
August 1996: A design by Fumio TOKI was adopted.
August 1996: A design by Fumio TOKI was adopted.

sen.j: 1998年10月 関西館の建設工事が着工される。
sen.e: October 1998: Construction of the Kansai-kan started.
October 1998: Construction of the Kansai-kan started.
October 1998: Construction of the Kansai-kan started.

sen.j: 2002年3月 完工、引渡式挙行。
sen.e: March 2002: Construction was completed and a handover ceremony was held.
March 2002: Construction was completed and a handover ceremony was held.
March 2002: Construction was completed and a handover ceremony was held.

sen.j: 同年4月 関西館設置
sen.e: April 2002: Kansai-kan was established.
April 2002: The Kansai-kan was established.
April 2002: The Kansai-kan was established.

sen.j: 同年9月 本館からの資料移転が終了。
sen.e: September 2002: Transfer of library materials from the Main Library was completed.
September 2002: The transfer of library materials from the Main Library was completed.
September 2002: The transfer of library materials from the Main Library was completed.

sen.j: 同年10月 関西館、開館。
sen.e: October 2002: Kansai-kan opened.
October 2002: The Kansai-kan opened.
October 2002: The Kansai-kan opened.

sen.j: 遠隔地へのサービスとアジア情報に重点を置いている。
sen.e: Areas of focus are services of remote use and services of Asian information.
The areas of focus are services of remote use and Asian information services.
The areas of focus are services of remote use and Asian information services.

sen.j: また、関西館設置に伴い、国内出版物の納本冊数が2冊となったが、うち一冊は関西館に収蔵される。
sen.e: In tandem with the establishment of the Kansai-kan, the required number for deposits for domestic publications increased to two copies, one of which is housed in the Kansai-kan.
In tandem with the establishment of the Kansai-kan, the required number for deposits for domestic publications increased to two copies, one of which is housed in the Kansai-kan.
In tandem with the establishment of the Kansai-kan, the required number of deposits for domestic publications increased to two copies, one of which is housed in the Kansai-kan.
sen.cmt: the required number for deposits の前置詞を修正

sen.j: これらの資料を収蔵する閉架式書庫には、収蔵能力を高めるために国内最大規模の移動書庫が採用され、コンピュータ制御の無人搬送車で資料の書庫からの出し入れを自動化するなど、情報化社会に対応しようと試みている。
sen.e: As for the closed stacks for these acquired materials, one of the Japan's largest movable stacks has been adopted to increase its storage capacity. At the Kansai-kan, the process of putting in and taking out the materials from the stacks has been automated with guided vehicles controlled by computers, providing advanced services suitable for information society,

As for the closed stacks for these acquired materials, one of Japan's largest movable stacks has been adopted to increase its storage capacity; meanwhile at the Kansai-kan, the process of putting in and taking out the materials from the stacks has been automated with guided vehicles controlled by computers, providing advanced services suitable for the information society,

As for the closed stacks for these acquired materials, one of Japan's largest movable stacks has been adopted to increase its storage capacity; meanwhile at the Kansai-kan, the process of putting in and taking out the materials from the stacks has been automated with guided vehicles controlled by computers, providing advanced services suitable for the information society,

sen.j: 閲覧室には検索用の端末が用意され、蔵書検索や閉架図書の閲覧請求などが可能となっている。
sen.e: It is possible to search the materials housed in the Kansai-kan or to request the materials in the closed stacks by using the terminals in the reading rooms.
One can search the materials housed in the Kansai-kan or request the materials in the closed stacks by using the terminals in the reading rooms.
One can search the materials housed in the Kansai-kan or request the materials in the closed stacks by using the terminals in the reading rooms.

sen.j: 一方、総合閲覧室には、開架式で日本語および欧米語の参考図書、抄録・索引誌、国内の官庁出版物・法令議会資料、図書館情報学資料、主要な雑誌・新聞、全国の電話帳が閲覧に供されている。
sen.e: On the other hand, the General Collections Room holds in open stacks the reference books, abstracts, indexes, domestic government publications/statutes and parliamentary documents, library and information science materials, major periodicals and newspapers, nationwide telephone directories, etc. in Japanese and other languages.

Moreover, the General Collections Room holds, in open stacks, the reference books, abstracts, indexes, domestic government publications/statutes and parliamentary documents, library and information science materials, major periodicals and newspapers, nationwide telephone directories, etc., in Japanese and other languages.

Moreover, the General Collections Room holds, in open stacks, the reference books, abstracts, indexes, domestic government publications/statutes and parliamentary documents, library and information science materials, major periodicals and newspapers, nationwide telephone directories, etc., in Japanese and other languages.

sen.j: アジア情報室では、アジアに関連する日本語および外国語の図書、定期刊行物（雑誌、学術誌）、新聞などが開架式図書館に配架されている。
sen.e: The Asian Resources Room holds in open stacks books, serials (periodicals, academic journals), newspapers, etc. in Japanese and other languages concerning Asia.
The Asian Resources Room holds, in open stacks, books, serials (periodicals, academic journals), newspapers, etc., in Japanese and other languages concerning Asia.
The Asian Resources Room holds, in open stacks, books, serials (periodicals, academic journals), newspapers, etc., in Japanese and other languages concerning Asia.

sen.j: また、アジア各国の書誌情報や図書館所蔵、新聞記事名検索データベースを利用できる端末もあるが、一部については印刷が出来ない。
sen.e: There are also terminals with databases for searching bibliographic data of Asian countries, materials housed in the library, newspaper article, but some of the contents cannot be printed.
There are also terminals with databases for searching bibliographic data of Asian countries, materials housed in the library, and newspaper articles, but some of the contents cannot be printed.
There are also terminals with databases for searching bibliographic data of Asian countries, materials housed in the library, and newspaper articles, but some of the contents cannot be printed.

sen.j: 希望者は、閲覧室のほか研究室の利用も可能である。
sen.e: Those who make a request can use the study rooms in addition to the reading rooms.
Those who make a request can use the study rooms in addition to the reading rooms.
Those who make a request can use the study rooms in addition to the reading rooms.

sen.j: ただし、同館資料を利用する場合に限られる。
sen.e: However, the usage is limited for reading materials housed in the Kansai-kan.
However, the usage is limited to the reading of materials housed in the Kansai-kan.
However, the usage is limited to the reading of materials housed in the Kansai-kan.

sen.j: 4階にカフェテリアおよび売店がある。
sen.e: There are a cafeteria and a kiosk on the fourth floor.
The fourth floor has a cafeteria and a kiosk.
The fourth floor has a cafeteria and a kiosk.

sen.j: 現在は衆議院共済組合が運営しているが、今後は運営業者の公募が行われる予定である。
sen.e: These are currently operated by the Mutual Aid Association of the House of Representatives, but operators will be selected from the public in the future.
These are currently operated by the Mutual Aid Association of the House of Representatives, but in the future operators will be selected from the public.
These are currently operated by the Mutual Aid Association of the House of Representatives, but in the future operators will be selected from the public.

sen.j: 館外にもファミリーレストランが数軒ある。
sen.e: There are several restaurants outside the library.
There are several restaurants outside the library.
There are several restaurants outside the library.

sen.j: 片町線 祝園駅・近鉄京都線 新祝園駅から奈良交通バス39・41系統もしくは精華くるりんバス南ルートに乗車、国立国会図書館下車（所要時間10分）。
sen.e: From Hosono Station (JR Katamachi Line) or Shin-Hosono Station (Kintetsu Kyoto Line), take the Nara Kotsu Bus 39 or 41, or the South route of the Seika Kururin Bus, and get off at the "Kokuritsu Kokkai Toshokan" (National Diet Library). (Time required: approximately 10 minutes)
sen.cmt: 国立国会図書館関西館のWebサイト（http://www.ndl.go.jp/jp/service/kansai/visit_info/route.html#public_trans）では、奈良交通バス「39・41系統」ではなく、「36・41・47系統」となっていますが、ここでは原文通り訳しました。
sen.e: From Hosono Station (JR Katamachi Line) or Shin-Hosono Station (Kintetsu Kyoto Line), take the Nara Kotsu Bus 39 or 41, or the south route of the Seika Kururin Bus, and get off at the "Kokuritsu Kokkai Toshokan" (National Diet Library) (time required: approximately 10 minutes).

From Hosono Station (JR Katamachi Line) or Shin-Hosono Station (Kintetsu Kyoto Line), take the Nara Kotsu Bus 39 or 41, or the south route of the Seika Kururin Bus, and get off at the "Kokuritsu Kokkai Toshokan" (National Diet Library) (time required: approximately 10 minutes).

sen.j: 近鉄けいはんな線 学研奈良登美ヶ丘駅から奈良交通バス41・47・48系統に乗車、国立国会図書館下車（所要時間 約15分）。
sen.e: From Gakken-Nara-Tomigaoka Station (Kintetsu-Keihanna Line), take the Nara Kotsu Bus 41, 47, or 48, and get off at the "Kokuritsu Kokkai Toshokan" (National Diet Library). (Time required: approximately 15 minutes)
sen.cmt: 国立国会図書館関西館のWebサイト（http://www.ndl.go.jp/jp/service/kansai/visit_info/route.html#public_trans）では、奈良交通バス「41・47・48系統」ではなく、「41・47系統」となっていますが、ここでは原文通り訳しました。
sen.e: From Gakken-Nara-Tomigaoka Station (Kintetsu-Keihanna Line), take Nara Kotsu Bus 41, 47 or 48 and get off at the "Kokuritsu Kokkai Toshokan" (National Diet Library) (time required: approximately 15 minutes).

From Gakken-Nara-Tomigaoka Station (Kintetsu-Keihanna Line), take Nara Kotsu Bus 41, 47 or 48 and get off at the "Kokuritsu Kokkai Toshokan" (National Diet Library) (time required: approximately 15 minutes).
